types.name: BidInput
types.description:
Send this to make the bid on the hand given by the specified id.
Only possible if the specified hand belongs to the user.

types.name: BiddingOption
types.description:
The bids the player can make for their hands.
This enum is used for the communication into the system. It prevents the usage of NOTHING.

types.name: BiddingPublic
types.description:
The public bids that are derived from the bids the players can make for their hands.
This enum is used for the communication out of the system.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: ByteArray
types.description: Array of bytes.

fields.name: callType
fields.description: The type of this call.

fields.name: cardsPlayedBefore
fields.description: The number of cards tha hand had already played when this call was made.

fields.name: cu
fields.description: The created and updated meta data of this game.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of this call.

fields.name: hand
fields.description: The hand this call was made by.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The UUID of this call.

fields.name: round
fields.description: The round this call was made in.

types.name: CallType
types.description: The different types of calls that can be made.

types.name: CardDemand
types.description: The first card of each trick defined the [CardDemand] that MUST be satisfied by a hand, if it can.

types.name: CreateGameInput
types.description: Send this to create a new game.

inputFields.name: playerLimit
inputFields.description: How many players are at most allowed to join the game.

inputFields.name: seed
inputFields.description: The seed to use for the game encoded as Base64. If null, a random seed is generated

types.name: CreatedUpdated
types.description: Object metadata that tracks when an object was created and updated.

fields.name: created
fields.description: The object was created at this moment.

fields.name: updated
fields.description: The object was updated the last time at this moment.

types.name: DeclarationOption
types.description:
The declaration options the player can make on their hands.
This enum is used for the communication into the system. It prevents the usage of NOTHING and offers the SILENT_MARRIAGE
option that is hidden to the outside in DeclarationPublic.

types.name: DeclarationPublic
types.description:
The public declarations that are derived from the declarations the players can make for their hands.
This enum hides the SILENT_MARRIAGE option from the public.

types.name: DeclareInput
types.description:
Send this to make the declaration on the hand given by the specified id.
Only possible if the specified hand belongs to the user.

types.name: DefiniteTeam
types.description:
The Doppelkopf game has two teams playing against each other, RE and KO.
This enum only allows these two options to reflect objects that can only have a definite Team assigned.

types.name: Game
types.description: Information about a game of Doppelkopf.

fields.name: cu
fields.description: The created and updated meta data of this game.

fields.name: currentRound
fields.description: The current active round of this game if there is one, otherwise null.

fields.name: id
fields.description: "The UUID of this game."

fields.name: player
fields.description: The player of the current user if they are playing in this game, otherwise null.

fields.name: playerLimit
fields.description: How many players are at most allowed to join this game.

fields.name: players
fields.description: The players of this game.

fields.name: rounds
fields.description: The rounds of this game.

fields.name: se
fields.description: The started and ended moments of this game.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The current state of this game.

types.name: GameState
types.description: Indicates the current phase the game is in.

types.name: HasCreatedUpdated
types.description: Common interface for all types that provide CreatedUpdated time instant information.

types.name: HasStartedEnded
types.description: Common interface for all types that provide StartedEnded time instant information.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Instant
types.description: Instant in time.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: JoinGameInput
types.description: Join a game at the specified seat as player.

inputFields.name: gameId
inputFields.description: The UUID of the game to join.

types.name: MakeCallInput
types.description: Send this to make a call for the hand specified by id.

types.name: Mutation
types.description: All mutations this graphQL API supports.

fields.name: bid
fields.description: Make a bid for the hand based on the provided data.

fields.name: createGame
fields.description: Create a new game based on the provided data.

fields.name: createRound
fields.description: Deal cards in the specified game to create a new round.

fields.name: declare
fields.description: Make a declare for the hand based on the provided data.

fields.name: joinGame
fields.description: Join a game as user to create a new player.

fields.name: makeCall
fields.description: Make a call in the round based on the provided data.

fields.name: playCard
fields.description: Play a card in the round based on the provided data.

fields.name: startGame
fields.description: Start the game with the specified id.

types.name: PlayCardInput
types.description: Send this to play the card in the round with the specified id.

inputFields.name: card
inputFields.description:
The card you want to play.
Must be one of the remaining cards on your hand.

inputFields.name: roundId
inputFields.description: The UUID of the round to play the card in.

types.name: Player
types.description: Information about the player, that is a user in a game.

fields.name: cu
fields.description: The created and updated meta data of this game.

fields.name: dealer
fields.description: Is this player is the current dealer in the game.

fields.name: game
fields.description: The game this player is playing in.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The UUID of this player.

fields.name: seat
fields.description: The number of the seat this player is sitting on in the game.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user that is playing in the game as this player.

types.name: PointsResult
types.description: The points divided in multiple categories.

types.name: PointsResultSpecial
types.description: These special points can only be obtained when the round is played according to the NORMAL or MARRIAGE contract.

fields.name: charly
fields.description: If the last trick is won with Jack of Clubs (charly), the team scoring this trick gets 1 extra point.

fields.name: doppelkopf
fields.description: Each trick that has 40 or more score, give the team that scored this trick 1 extra point.

fields.name: opposition
fields.description: If KO wins against RE, they get an extra point.

types.name: PointsResultTeamCalls
types.description: The points for the team calls of each teams.

fields.name: ko
fields.description: The winner gets 2 points if KO made their team call.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The winner gets 2 points if RE made their team call.

types.name: PointsResultUnderCalls
types.description: The points for the under calls of each team.

fields.name: ko
fields.description: The winner gets 1 point for each under call made by KO team.

fields.name: re
fields.description: The winner gets 1 point for each under call made by RE team.

types.name: PrivateHand
types.description:
Private information about a hand.
This is only available to the owner of the hand.

fields.name: cardsPlayed
fields.description: The cards that were already played by this hand.

fields.name: cardsRemaining
fields.description: The cards that this hand has still to play.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The UUID of this hand.

fields.name: public
fields.description: The public information about this hand.

fields.name: team
fields.description: The team this hands plays on, from the viewpoint of the player of this hand.

types.name: PrivateUser
types.description: Information about a user that is only available to that user themselves.

types.name: PublicHand
types.description: Public information about a hand.

fields.name: bid
fields.description: The bid of this hand if it was already made.

fields.name: calls
fields.description: The calls made by this hand.

fields.name: cu
fields.description: The created and updated meta data of this game.

fields.name: declared
fields.description: The declaration of this hand if it was already made.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The UUID of this hand.

fields.name: player
fields.description: The player this hand is played by.

fields.name: round
fields.description: The round this hand is played in.

fields.name: team
fields.description: The team this hands plays on, from the viewpoint of other players in the game.

types.name: PublicUser
types.description: Information about a user that is available to all other users.

types.name: Query
types.description: All queries this graphQL API supports.

fields.name: call
fields.description: Get information about the call with the specified id.

fields.name: game
fields.description: Get information about the game with the specified id.

fields.name: games
fields.description: Get all games currently available.

fields.name: player
fields.description: Get information about the player with the specified id.

fields.name: privateHand
fields.description:
Get the private information about the hand with the specified id.
This can only be used by the owner of the hand.

fields.name: privateUser
fields.description: Gets detailed information about the current user.

fields.name: publicHand
fields.description: Get the public information about the hand with the specified id.

fields.name: publicUser
fields.description: Gets the public information about the user with the specified id.

fields.name: round
fields.description: Get information about the round with the specified id.

fields.name: trick
fields.description: Get information about the trick with the specified id.

fields.name: turn
fields.description: Get information about the turn with the specified id.

types.name: Round
types.description: Information about a round in a game of Doppelkopf.

fields.name: calls
fields.description: The calls made in this round.

fields.name: contract
fields.description: The public contract information of the round.

fields.name: cu
fields.description: The created and updated meta data of this game.

fields.name: currentTrick
fields.description: The current active trick of this round if there is one, otherwise null.

fields.name: dealer
fields.description: The player that dealt this round.

fields.name: game
fields.description: The game this round is played in.

fields.name: hand
fields.description:
The private information about the hand.
This shows the hand of the player, if the authenticated user has a hand in this round. Otherwise null.

fields.name: hands
fields.description: The public information about the hands of the players.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The UUID of this round.

fields.name: number
fields.description: The number of this round, incrementally starting at 1.

fields.name: result
fields.description: The result of this round if available, otherwise null.

fields.name: se
fields.description: The started and ended moments of this game.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The current state of the round.

fields.name: tricks
fields.description: The tricks of this round.

fields.name: turns
fields.description: The turns made in this round.

types.name: RoundContractPublic
types.description:
Indicates the specific variant of the round that is played based on the game rules.
This enum hides the SILENT_MARRIAGE option from the public.

types.name: RoundResult
types.description: Information about a result of a round in a game of Doppelkopf.

fields.name: cu
fields.description: The created and updated meta data of this game.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The UUID of this result.

fields.name: points
fields.description: The points awarded to this team.

fields.name: round
fields.description: The round this result is from.

fields.name: scoreObtained
fields.description: The total score this team obtained.

fields.name: scoreTarget
fields.description: The target score this team must obtain.

fields.name: team
fields.description: The team this result is for.

fields.name: trickCount
fields.description: The number of tricks this team obtained.

types.name: RoundState
types.description: Indicates the current phase the round is in.

types.name: ScoreQuadruple
types.description:
There are multiple aspects of Doppelkopf using the 4 levels (90, 60, 30, 0), e.g. calls, score level.
This type allows us to have a simple representation of these aspects.

types.name: StartedEnded
types.description: Object metadata that tracks when an object was started and ended.

fields.name: ended
fields.description: The parent object was ended at this moment. If this is null, the parent object was not ended yet.

fields.name: started
fields.description: The parent object was started at this moment. If this is null, the parent object was not started yet.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Team
types.description:
The Doppelkopf game has two teams playing against each other, RE and KO.
This enum allows for the NA option if the team is not yet known.

types.name: TeamedResult
types.description: Results tagged with the corresponding team.

fields.name: ko
fields.description: Result of the ko team.

fields.name: re
fields.description: Result of the re team.

types.name: Trick
types.description: Information about a Trick in a round of Doppelkopf.

fields.name: cards
fields.description: The cards that this trick currently contains in order.

fields.name: cu
fields.description: The created and updated meta data of this game.

fields.name: demand
fields.description: The demand of this trick.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The UUID of this trick.

fields.name: leadingCardIndex
fields.description: The index of the currently leading card of this trick with respect to the cards list.

fields.name: number
fields.description: The number of this trick with respect to the round.

fields.name: openIndex
fields.description: The index of the hand that played the first card of this hand.

fields.name: round
fields.description: The round this trick is played in.

fields.name: score
fields.description: The current score of this trick.

fields.name: se
fields.description: The started and ended moments of this game.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The current state of this trick.

fields.name: winner
fields.description: The winner of this trick if known, otherwise null.

types.name: TrickState
types.description: Indicates the current phase the trick is in.

types.name: Turn
types.description: Information about a turn in a round and trick of Doppelkopf.

fields.name: card
fields.description: The card played in this turn.

fields.name: cu
fields.description: The created and updated meta data of this game.

fields.name: hand
fields.description: The the hand this turn is made by.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The UUID of this turn.

fields.name: number
fields.description: The number of this turn, incrementally starting at 1.

fields.name: round
fields.description: The round this turn is made in.

fields.name: trick
fields.description: The trick this turn is made in.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: defer
directives.description: This directive allows results to be deferred during execution

args.name: if
args.description: Deferred behaviour is controlled by this argument

args.name: label
args.description: A unique label that represents the fragment being deferred

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks the field, argument, input field or enum value as deprecated

directives.name: experimental_disableErrorPropagation
directives.description: This directive disables error propagation when a non nullable field returns null for the given operation.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true

directives.name: oneOf
directives.description: Indicates an Input Object is a OneOf Input Object.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
